fields.description:
see discussion in ARROW-1474

My plan is to separate the stylecheck fixes into manageable chunks so they are easier to review.  I'll do this by enabling the build to fail on style, then suppressing all checks but the ones to be fixed.

comments.body: [~siddteotia] do you think this could get done in under ~2 weeks? Otherwise, we should move to 0.11
[~wesmckinn], I am not entirely sure if I will get to it in the next week or so. Definitely shooting for it though.
Would it help to break this up into parts by only enabling certain rules at a time?  Like fixing import order first, etc.
Yes, sounds good to me. Please feel free to bite of a chunk of work and add some child JIRAs
Moved to 0.11 since it doesn't look like this will get completely done in 0.10
Any chance to get this into 0.11? [~siddteotia] [~bryanc]?
I'll start looking into this and break it into smaller tasks if it makes sense.  I'll reassign to myself, unless you still want to take it [~siddteotia].
[~bryanc] where are we at on this for 0.12?
I think I can finish this up by 0.12, just need to enable Javadoc checks and then do a little writeup of the style changes
OK great, I am leaving in 0.12
